etymology.description: Depicts a broad field, originally representing a seedling sprouting from the earth, later associated with 'man' or 'male name'.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a pictogram representing soil and a growing plant, 甫(甫) (fǔ, 'man') evolved to also symbolize a person, often used in names as a prefix denoting masculinity or adulthood.

examples.chinese: 他是一位正直的甫(他是一位正直的甫)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī wèi zhèngzhí de fǔ.

examples.chinese: 古时英豪皆尊甫为表率(古時英豪皆尊甫為表率)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshí yīngháo jiē zūn fǔ wéi biǎolǜ.
examples.english: In ancient times, heroes all revered the man as a role model.

examples.chinese: 文史名家赞扬这位甫(文史名家讚揚這位甫)。
examples.pinyin: Wénshǐ míngjiā zànyáng zhè wèi fǔ.
examples.english: Prominent writers and historians praised this man.
